pullRequest.body:
Adds functoriality of adic completions.

---

bors d+

Sorry forgot about this.
LGTM modulo the comment

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```
Why `R ‚ß∏ (I ‚Ä¢ ‚ä§ : Ideal R)` instead of `R ‚ß∏ I`?
Because I thought it is more convenient to work with, because of the definition of `AdicCompletion I R`. Turns out, it's also doable with the canonical spelling, so I changed it.
I think this should be called `AdicCauchySequence.map`?
Similar for this.
Is this intended to be called `LinearMap.AdicCompletion.ext`?
I changed it to `AdicCompletion.map_ext`, but I am not sure if this is the correct naming. Note that `AdicCompletion.ext` is already taken.
Is `AdicCompletion.mk` a linearMap? If so, maybe `(h : f.comp (AdicCompletion.mk I M a) = _)` instead.  See note [partially-applied ext lemmas]
Yes it is, I changed it. For the `map_ext''` version, I left it as is for now, because I did not see a way without asking more conditions on `T`. If this is desirable anyway, let me know.

```suggestion
    ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.univ, of Œ≤ i (x i) = x := by
  change (‚àë i ‚àà Finset.univ, DFinsupp.single i (x i)) = x
```
The syntax changed recently.

```suggestion
  letI f := map I (linearEquivFunOnFintype R Œπ M)
  letI g := linearEquivFunOnFintype (AdicCompletion I R) Œπ (fun j ‚Ü¶ AdicCompletion I (M j))
  g.symm.toLinearMap ‚àò‚Çó pi I M ‚àò‚Çó f
```
This makes `let` disappear in the constructed term.

```suggestion
@[local simp]
```
Did you really use this somewhere? I doubt so.
No, they only appear in `simp only` calls. I changed it to `local simp` as suggested, should I remove it completely instead?

```suggestion
@[local simp]
```
I don't think you used this anywhere as well?

```suggestion
  letI f := (congr I (linearEquivFunOnFintype R Œπ M)).symm
  letI g := (linearEquivFunOnFintype (AdicCompletion I R) Œπ (fun j ‚Ü¶ AdicCompletion I (M j)))
```
This should be the `@[ext]` lemma instead. See [partially-applied ext lemmas].
Instead of `map_ext`?
Yes.
Okay now that I think about it more, maybe it doesn't matter.
Can you at least add a comment about this? I had the same concern,
I swapped the `@[ext]`.
Do we really need this `change`? If so we are maybe missing a lemma.

I tried to add various rewrite lemmas, even `lemma foo [Fintype Œπ] (x : ‚®Å i, Œ≤ i) : /‚àë i ‚àà Finset.univ, of Œ≤ i (x i)) = ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.univ, DFinsupp.single i (x i)`, but it I can't get it to work without the `change`.
I found the missing piece, updated.
Nonterminal `simp`.

```suggestion
- `LinearMap.adicCauchy I f`: the linear map on `I`-adic cauchy sequences induced by `f`
- `LinearMap.adicCompletion I f`: the by `f` induced linear map on `I`-adic completions
```
Is this what you mean?
Yes
Can you use `dsimp only`? Thanks!
